Chairman @TomEmmer: I hope your @NRCC will agree to these principles. If you have suggestions about how we could strengthen this pledge, I would welcome a dialogue.

Our Committees must work together and stand for the safety & security of our democracy over any partisan goals.
We call on the chief election officers in all states to ensure the most robust fortification and protection of elections systems leading up to, and during, the 2020 election.
Any foreign actors attempting to participate, operate, influence or contact the Committee or any of our campaigns will be reported to appropriate law enforcement immediately.
We will encourage all campaigns to report any receipt of, or offers to receive, stolen and/or hacked information to law enforcement.

We will not support any campaign or allied groups that use known stolen and/or hacked information, or that promotes or disseminates stolen and/or hacked materials to the press, regardless of the source.

We will never use known stolen and/or hacked information, or promote or disseminate stolen and/or hacked materials to the press, regardless of the source and will report any receipt of, or offers to receive, stolen and/or hacked information to law enforcement.
We will never seek out stolen and/or hacked information for use in any operations.

As public servants, @TomEmmer and I both swore an oath to protect and defend our Constitution. The @dccc has pledged to the following:

We will not participate, aid or encourage hackers or foreign actors in any attempt to influence American elections.

Six months ago, I sent @TomEmmer a letter to invite the NRCC to sign a common-sense pledge to keep our country safe and our elections secure. The urgency I conveyed in April has not dissipated.

In fact, the importance of this issue has only grown.

We commit to carrying forward his legacy in the limited time allotted to each of us‚Äîto give voice to the voiceless, to defend our democracy, and to always reach for higher ground.

Sometimes, after a big event, he would take us aside for a quiet moment and say, ‚ÄúI just want to thank you for everything you do and for being a part of my destiny.‚Äù

Today, we thank him for being part of ours.

Selling your DC hotel is no solution.  Your gargantuan global foreign payments & benefits continue‚Äîat condos, rental properties & hotels.  (Note: Trump Towers Turkey.) Your contempt for the Constitutional bar on Emoluments is staggering. https://www.wsj.com/articles/trump-organization-exploring-sale-of-marquee-washington-hotel-11572019874

But, of course, he left us with instructions: ‚ÄúPain, passion, purpose. Take your pain, turn it into your passion, and make it your purpose.‚Äù He lived those words, and he inspired us to do the same.

He had so much left to accomplish, but he has left it for us to complete.  As he told us presciently, ‚Äúthese things don‚Äôt happen to us, they happen for us.‚Äù His spirit was so strong, and his energy so boundless, that the void is devastating.

He invoked history books that will be written hundreds of years from now as he called on us to ‚Äúfight for the soul of our democracy.‚Äù  As he said, this is bigger than one man, one president, or even one generation.
As staff, we committed to doing everything in our power to fulfill his vision. He was a unifying force, even in this era of partisanship.

The time for action was yesterday, last week, and last year.
